events.comment: 1. Set the title of the game that appears on the StartScreen
2. Enter short description of game to appear on StartScreen
3. Enter direction text to appear at bottom of SoundBoard game screen.
events.variable: Hover wires with mouse to hear their sounds.
events.comment: 4. Change the background color or image by editing the Image property of the TiledBackground object.

5. Edit the Image sprite's Animations property to include as many images as you'd like to display. The images will be paged automatically according to the number of Image instances (default 6) on the SoundBoard layout. A size of 250 x 250 pixels works best given the default layout of two rows and three columns.
6. Import your sounds corresponding to the images by right-clicking the Sounds folder in the Projects view, selecting Import Sounds, and choosing one or more WAV files from your local machine.

7. Edit the SoundFileList string below to include the names of the sound files now in your project's Sounds directory (minus the file extension). Each sound name should be separated from the next by a pipe (|) character, and the sounds must be in the same order as the corresponding image frames in the Image sprite's Animations property
8. (optional) Set color for navigation icons ("light" or "dark")

variable.comment: use light or dark theme for navigation icons
variable.name: NavigationIconColor

events.comment: 9. (optional) Set value below to 1 to provide way to navigate back to StartScreen (you may even decide that StartScreen is unnecessary for this game).

variable.comment: hide/show icon to navigate back to opening screen
variable.name: ShowHomeButton
